1.meaning: Infection that inflames air sacs in one or both lungs, which may fill with fluid.
1.summary: Pneumonia, the doctor said, confirming Alex's fears.

2.meaning: A faculty by which the body perceives an external stimulus; one of the faculties of sight, smell, hearing, taste, and touch.
2.summary: The bear has a keen sense of smell which enables it to hunt at dusk

3.meaning: Pleasing the senses or mind aesthetically.

4.meaning: A plan for carrying out a process or procedure, giving lists of intended events and times.
4.summary: We have drawn up an engineering schedule

5.meaning: Repeat or copy out (words from a text or speech written or spoken by another person).
5.summary: I realized she was quoting passages from Shakespeare

6.meaning: Able to be used or obtained; at someone's disposal.
6.summary: Refreshments will be available all afternoon

7.meaning: The fact or condition of being regarded or treated as more important than others.
7.summary: The safety of the country takes priority over any other matter

8.meaning: An unexpected or astonishing event, fact, etc.
8.summary: The announcement came as a complete surprise

9.meaning: A situation in which a difficult choice has to be made between two or more alternatives, especially ones that are equally undesirable.
9.summary: He wants to make money, but he also disapproves of it: Den's dilemma in a nutshell.

10.meaning: an educational institution or establishment, in particular.

11.meaning: Having or showing a cautious distrust of someone or something.
11.summary: He was suspicious of her motives

12.meaning: A precious stone consisting of a clear and colourless crystalline form of pure carbon, the hardest naturally occurring substance.

14.meaning: A long curved fruit which grows in clusters and has soft pulpy flesh and yellow skin when ripe.

15.meaning: Human beings in general or considered collectively.
15.summary: The people at work place are nice.

16.meaning: Able to accept or tolerate delays, problems, or suffering without becoming annoyed or anxious.
16.summary: Be patient, your time will come

17.meaning: a large African mammal with a very long neck and forelegs, having a coat patterned with brown patches separated by lighter lines. It is the tallest living animal.
17.summary: Those giraffe are taller than I imagined.

18.meaning: This is the meaning of word

19.meaning: A space entirely devoid of matter.
19.summary: The space is a giant vacuum.

20.meaning: the last (or last two) of the Pleistocene glaciations of North America, approximating to the Weichsel of northern Europe.
20.summary: the system of deposits laid down at the time of the Wisconsin glaciation.

21.meaning: God be praised (uttered in worship or as an expression of rejoicing).

22.summary: Snow caused chaos in the region.

24.meaning: A person, typically a woman, employed to look after a child in its own home.
24.summary: Katie works as a part time nanny for them.

25.summary: She feels that he does not appreciate her.

26.meaning: Europe is a continent that comprises the westernmost part of Eurasia. Europe is bordered by the Arctic Ocean to the north, the Atlantic Ocean to the west, and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.
26.summary: Coldplay's next show is somewhere in Europe.

27.meaning: a condition in which faeces are discharged from the bowels frequently and in a liquid form.
27.summary: A range of symptoms including diarrhoea and vomiting.

28.summary: A pub has to be licensed by the local justices.

29.meaning: Equivalent to the product of three and four; two more than ten; 12.

30.meaning: Better, greater, or otherwise different from what is usual.
30.summary: They always made a special effort at Christmas.

31.meaning: Equivalent to the product of nine and ten; ten less than one hundred; 90.

32.meaning: The action of receiving something or the fact of its being received.
32.summary: I would be grateful if you would acknowledge receipt of this letter

33.meaning: A disorder of structure or function in a human, animal, or plant, especially one that produces specific symptoms or that affects a specific location and is not simply a direct result of physical injury.
33.summary: bacterial meningitis is quite a rare disease

34.summary: the man was a notorious liar

35.meaning: A German dish of chopped pickled cabbage.
35.summary: Another round of sauerkraut for me please.

36.meaning: a spiritual being believed to act as an attendant, agent, or messenger of God, conventionally represented in human form with wings and a long robe.
36.summary: God sent an angel to talk to Gideon
